result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:22 PM Defendant Andrew J. Berger appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Defendant does not have an attorney, is not eligible for public defender, just submitted paperwork for court appointed attorney.

Court will adjourn matter.

Bond is continued.

Court will review the appointment of counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/31/22 - insufficient address

1:41 PM Defendant Andrew J. Berger in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant requests more time to get an attorney.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew J. Berger
Current: 1600 Briggs St., c/o Salvation Army, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2022)
Prior: 2936 Hickory Dr, Plover, WI 54467
No contact with B.L. or her residence

2:32 PM Defendant Andrew J. Berger in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Pfeil calls the case and state the appearances.
Defendant appears without counsel.

Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
ADA Pfeil provides the defendant with the complaint.
Court questions the defendant if he wishes to have counsel represent him.
Defendant is looking at retaining his own counsel.
Court will not go out 60 days for an adjournment but will go out 30 days.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
ADA Pfeil does not object to an adjournment.
ADA Pfeil would request a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for August 29, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
